str2: This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A hidden rock; fig: a flaw, stigma. Of uncertain derivation; a ledge or reef of rock in the sea.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
Fearlessly, shamelessly, securely, tranquilly. Adverb from a compound of a and phobos; fearlessly.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To feast sumptuously with.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To shepherd, tend, herd; hence: I rule, govern. From poimen; to tend as a shepherd of.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
A cloud. From nephos; properly, cloudiness, i.e. a cloud.
Without water, dry; subst: dry places, desert. Waterless, i.e. Dry.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: From para and phero; to bear along or aside, i.e. Carry off; by implication, to avert.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.
Unfruitful, barren, profitless. Barren.
A tree. Probably from drus; a tree.
Autumnal, in autumn, when fruit is expected. From derivative of phthino and opora; autumnal.
Twice, entirely, utterly. Adverb from duo; twice.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: To root out, pluck up by the roots. From ek and rhizoo; to uproot.
